title: “Kindly Cable Me at the Earliest Moment”: James Henry Breasted’s Role in Building the Egyptian Collection
short_description: In 1919, Art Institute President Charles L. Hutchinson asked his friend James Henry Breasted, founder of the Oriental Institute at the University of Chicago, to act as a purchasing agent for the Art Institute during a trip to Egypt. A series of letters and cables between the men reveals the story of the antiquities trade in Egypt and of Breasted's heroic efforts for the Art Institute.

input: “Kindly Cable Me at the Earliest Moment”: James Henry Breasted’s Role in Building the Egyptian Collection
